titles.title: Dynamic Scheduling of Multiple Hidden Markov Model-Based Sensors

Optimal measurement scheduling for state estimation. IEEE Transactions on Aerospace and Electronic System, 31 (1995), 716—729. Woosun An is currently a Ph.D. student in electrical and computer engineering at the University of Connecticut (UConn). He received his B.S. degree in electrical engineering from the University of Chung Ang, South Korea in 2001. He received his M.S. degree in electrical engineering from the University of Florida in 2005. He received UConn engineering summer fellowship award in 2007 and 2008. His research interests include dynamic sensor scheduling, graphical models, and optimization theory. Satnam Singh is currently a Ph.D. student in electrical and computer engineering at the University of Connecticut (UConn). He received his B.S. degree in chemical engineering from the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Rookree, India in 1996. He received his M.S. degree in electrical engineering from the University of Wyoming in 2003. Prior to his graduate studies, he worked as a design engineer in Engineers India Limited, New Delhi, India for 4 years. He is a reviewer for IEEE Potentials magazine for the past three years and he has also served as the President of IEEE Student Branch at UConn during 2003—04. He received UConn engineering summer fellowship award in 2006. His research interests include data mining, graphical models, pattern recognition, fault detection and diagnosis, and optimization theory.
